verbs: You have a right to duty, but not to its fruits
Perform duty with equanimity, abandoning attachment
The self-controlled soul finds peace in the Self
The mind is restless; steady it through practice
Surrendering all actions to Me, be free from desire
Unattached to results, ever content and independent
Set thy heart upon thy work, but never on its reward
The soul is unborn, eternal, changeless and ancient
One who is unattached finds perfect peace
Engage in battle with equanimity of mind
Yoga is skill in action, equanimity in all states
The disciplined self moves among sense objects
Neither agitated by pain nor longing for pleasure
Cut the doubts in your heart with the sword of knowledge
Abandoning attachment, perform actions as sacrifice
The soul is neither born nor does it ever die
Fixed in yoga, perform actions with balance
Focusing the mind and senses on the Supreme
One who sees inaction in action attains peace
With mind absorbed in Me, you shall overcome all
